And California congressman Eric Swalwell causing controversy a little bit for a response during a twitter battle with a conservative pundit, the social media has been erupting after a second amendment supporter pointed out that Swalwell once called for gun owners to surrender their assault weapons. The congressman tweeting this response, quote, and it would be a short war, my friend. The government has nukes.  Too many of them. But they're legit. I'm sure if we talk we could find common ground to protect our families and communities. Swalwell later backtracked after getting slammed for his remarks claiming he was just being sarcastic. I think -- can we give him a pass on being sarcastic, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, this is the issue -- there's no sarcastic font on twitter and everybody gets burned on this. I know what he was saying. If you take it at the initial, it's like saying, yeah, your guns are no match for our nukes, but that wasn't really what he was saying. What he was saying is that -- it's pretty unlikely an armed population would be able -- it's irrelevant in this day and age with nuclear power. In the 1800's, it would. But the thing is I think that's flawed because no country like the United States would actually use nuclear weapons on a city. They wouldn't do that --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: But wait, let's take your argument seriously because I hear this from gun owners who say, you know, if I keep my guns and the government -- tyranny cannot occur in the USA --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- because we can fight back. So, forget the nukes stuff which I think what sarcastic and over the top. But the reality is what a bogus argument because it's not a matter of nukes. Gosh, the U.S. stockpile of weapons and the number of people in our military is so amazing that some guy who wants to go communist -- posse Comitatus is going nowhere.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think -- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb15', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb15', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I disagree.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Armed population, people that have a lawful, abiding owners of guns exists as a reminder of what right protects the other right. It's like, this is the last stand and you feel -- also, everybody remembers back in the day people lived in places where they had to protect themselves.  Now we have more police officers. But the fact is there's a feeling that this protects other rights. The problem with Swalwell is his buyback isn't really a buyback of its tie to criminal prosecution and that is a confiscation. And I think -- it's hard to trust people who play with the language. I mean, he said that a rifle is more powerful with a pistol grip. It's not more powerful. That makes no sense.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We can ask Katie about that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah. So, anyway -- what's ironic for me and then I'll shut up, people tying criminal prosecution to a buyback, if you don't give back the weapons, these are the people that say prisons are overcrowded. So you're going to get rid of a lot of people from prison and then packed them all with law-abiding gun owners.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Well, there are 300-plus-million guns in America. Buybacks are never voluntary. In Australia they did a buyback. And it was the government saying you're going to give us your guns or we're going to come prosecute you. Juan, you think the argument that having firearms is a deterrent against a tyrannical government is one that is may be updated or irrelevant now. But the entire purpose of the second amendment was for that sake --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, but that was a different time.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: But the second amendment is a right. It is not something you just change based on the times. And the idea that an armed society is a plague society is still important. And, although, we have more police officers, we have more government, in the end people still have to protect themselves inside their homes, in their cities, and when the government fails like after Hurricane Katrina and other natural disasters. So this idea that just because the government has nukes and can now take on their own people if they feel like it because they're fighting back with their second amendment rights is a little bit hard to swallow when it comes to the original intention of people having firearms to prevent against -- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb16', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb16', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It's hard for Swalwell. Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: No pun intended.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I call him General Swalwell.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He might run for president and it would be -- that's a hard name.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes. It doesn't roll off the tongue. I think he just nuked his chances to get pass the commander-in-chief test. Plus, you can't use a nuke in a civil war, everybody dies and everybody knows that. Democrats just have a hard time talking about guns. It's like a different language.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: May I interject, though? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb17', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb17', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Michael Bloomberg put in a lot of money to candidates -- talking about every -- what is it called? Every town, I think it was called. They had an 83 percent win rate for the targeted 66 races with their endorsement and their money. They won 83 percent of those. And even candidates, Virginia, Texas, Georgia, Washington, and in Colorado suburbs, in particular, they ran on sensible gun control. I'm not defining it, but that's what they would call it, and they won.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You know, I'm not so sure I could translate that money from Bloomberg into yes. Let's now claim we have a mandate to confiscate guns.  I think they'll probably ran to the center, to a moderate center on guns.  But the Democrats did not put like a contract for America out there like Newt Gingrich did, and now say, you know, we were given the keys to the house and now we're going to take away guns and we're going to impeach.  That's not what the American people sent you guys, therefore. You guys won on running that Trump is mean to minorities and women and health care, that's why you won. So, to misinterpret the mandate and go hard left on guns, they're going to really hurt themselves.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: If you want to reduce gun violence you do two things, you increase the number of police officers and you have a great economy. Since 1980, gun homicides have decreased by two-thirds and they've linked it to an increase in police, the calm stat system. But also, and it correlates with low unemployment. When low unemployment, then you have low homicides.  So a great -- I mean, a great economy and more police, you have less violence. I don't think buybacks -- I think buybacks are -- actually, the worst kind of thing to do because it's symbolic and not practical.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Who's not doing guy buybacks, people who want to do mass harm. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb18', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb18', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yeah, criminals don't turn them in.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Right. And each situation -- the frustration for me all the time is like each situation is very different, whether you're in Chicago, California, Florida. Each circumstance surrounding has happened, especially in Parkland, we're not holding people accountable who missed all the warning signs. You can implement all the gun control you want, but if you're not --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Let me just say, we just had a terrible shooting in California.  We know about the terrible shooting in Las Vegas.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Which also have gun control.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And here we have a situation where there's just too many guns --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So you want confiscation then. Is that what you want? if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You have so many people who have multiple weapons, all kinds of semi-automatic weapons, and this is not about defending your home. This is not about forming a militia --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: This is about people who have a fetish about guns --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Juan, I'm a person, I'm a person -- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And this is the reason why you see people like Bloomberg put money in and why it works because most Americans, and I think most of the people at this table if they told the truth are for --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Excuse me. I've never -- OK. Saying too many guns is exactly the mirror image of saying not enough guns. You're at one extreme demonizing the other.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, because if you look around the world, you look at other industrialized --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You have low rates of violence.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We have higher rates of gun violence --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, look at the stats. You've got to look at the stats. You're conflating suicide with homicide -- if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm talking about gun violence like we saw in California.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, you're wrong.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I'm a person who owns firearms in exactly the way that you just laid out. And I think that we have a pretty good relationship about who I am as a person. So, for you to indict people like me all over the country as people who are irresponsible who have fetishes over something that is a constitutional right --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: It's a constitutional right out of time. You've said, oh, this is a constitutional -- that goes back to the forming of a motion. But I will say this for you, the Supreme Court came down on your side. I'm just saying most Americans approves a reasonable inhibition on gun ownership in this country.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: How dare you insult fetishes?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: She has a fetish for the constitution.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, no.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have a fetish for things I can't talk about.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: On that note, ahead, what grade does President Trump give himself so far? The answer next on The Five.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Somebody is calling Greg right now. But, welcome back. In his revealing sit down on Fox News Sunday, President Trump credits his tone for his achievements on a variety of fronts. Watch.

utterances.speaker: PRESIDENT DONALD TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I think that if I was very different, I wouldn't have gotten what we had to get. We've got the biggest tax cuts in history. We got Anwar approved. We got rid of the individual mandate, which is the most unpopular thing you can imagine, health care. I got rid of it. Everybody said it would be impossible.  We've got rid of it. And many, many -- you know, the regulations. I think if I was, you know, more modified, more moderate in that sense, I don't think I would have done half of the things that I was able to get completed.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: So, Jesse, the White House has been able to get a lot done in the first two years. Do you think that he's right about his tone? Could another Republican president have gotten as much done if they weren't taking the same tough approach as Trump has?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You don't have to be moderate when you have the house and the senate, so there's that. I think he got a lot done with his tone and with his really aggressive approach on trade, on ISIS, on North Korea, and the economy, and judges, especially. But if you look at the two deficiency the first two years, we saw the wall wasn't built and health care. Now on health care, he didn't really have his heart in it and he farmed out to the congress and, you know, they kind of blew it for him. But -- and then McCain sank it at the end because of a personal vendetta and you want it to be bipartisan. On the wall, I thought he was pretty moderate on the wall. He was willing to give millions of DACA recipients a pathway to citizenship in exchange for funding, and then he had the S-hole country comment and the Schumer shutdown which screwed that up. I think the problem with Trump right now is he's wasted goodwill with the American people in certain circumstances.  When the country is not looking for a fighter, when the country is looking for a healer, he says things. If it's in Charlottesville, or if it's a moment of healing, if it's a national disaster, shootings, where the country wants when he mocks as boring and presidential. And I think being like that on 10 percent of the time would serve him well.  But the people that are complaining about his style and tone, this country was going over a cliff. If Hillary Clinton had been elected president that would have been 12 years after Barack Obama with a Democrat in the White House. And now people are complaining because he kind of ripped the wheel to the other side. It's jarring, but I rather, you know, be alive than dying a slow death.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The country was going over a cliff, Vladimir?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Why am I Vladimir?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Well, that's exactly what the Russians -- I don't get it. They put out this propaganda.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Who's Russia? Why are you talking about Russia?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, Russian propaganda --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, Hillary Clinton is such --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Three terms of a Democratic president --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What is it -- you know what amazed me about this interview? He gives himself an A-plus. An A-plus.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: We have the sound, let's listen to that and you can respond.

utterances.speaker: TRUMP
utterances.sentences: I would give myself -- look, I hate to do it, but I will do it. I would give myself an A-plus. Is that enough? Can I go higher than that?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: A-plus, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Again, it's unbelievable. It gets set in -- but he's done so much, I'm like -- well, first of all, A-plus? After you lose the house, you hear former presidents speak about being shellacked or thumbed, no, not Donald Trump. We won, we won. And then secondly, 38 percent of the American people approve of Donald Trump. My gosh, he gets an A-plus?  That's the rate of real clear politics average. And I'm just saying, my gosh, he gives himself an A-plus and it's just hyperbole. But it plays into this idea that, "Oh, yes, everything is great with North Korea." What did you accomplish with North Korea? I think they're building additional - -

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They haven't tested a nuclear rocket since the tough talk, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What, this is the greatest economy ever, says Donald Trump. Not true says all the fact-checkers. Not true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Better than the Obama economy.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Get out of here.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: How would you rate President Trump's performance, either on his tone or on his accomplishments?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, here's the deal, OK? This is under the assumption that the media would hate anyone less who was in the office other than Trump. They would have done this to Marco Rubio in a second, because he's pro-life. They would have ripped him to shreds. So I mean, the idea that, like, you know, this guy has a volatile -- believe me, no one would have fared well who lost [SIC] to Hillary Clinton, because it was a kick in the gut to everybody. Here's the issue. In negotiation, you stake out a far position, and you work to your middle. That's what you do in business, and he's translated it to politics. And people aren't used to the extreme positions that he takes in order to move back in the middle. So he'll talk about terror: "We kill all their families." Well, that's not what happens, but he works -- he gets people to thinking about terror, right? Or immigration, he'll say something. But now we're all talking and thinking about immigration. We're doing the Muslim ban, and we started talking about an actual practical ban on certain countries that weren't all Muslims. In fact, most Muslim countries weren't. It's like offering $25,000 for a $100,000 plot of land. That's where you start. And so he -- his opening bid gets everybody in the room's attention, and then he works back. Is it working? Yes. Because you noticed it's being adopted by the new Democrats. AOC, as I like to call her, you know, is the closest you're going to get to a young Trump.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Who is AOC?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Alexandria.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Alexandria. She -- she makes these really hard-core comments about socialism, and then she makes flubs but she, like, she's engaging.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, but she is an extreme in the party. I mean, this guy --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So Trump now is the party. It's the party of Trump.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: She takes a position and then moves back.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I mean, yesterday he goes after a former SEAL, 37 years, the man who captured [SIC] bin Laden and basically says, this is some Clinton supporter, Barack Obama supporter. Because the man says the kind of statements that Trump makes are so --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Why are you surprised by this? This is what he's been doing for two years. He -- if somebody says something bad about him, Juan, he's going to say something bad about him. I've learned to live with that and put that into a box.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: How do you put it in a box when he says, "Oh, I don't know who killed Jamal Khashoggi." You know, that --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That was premature.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- Mohammad bin Salman just told me. He told me, despite all the intelligence collected by the CIA and everybody else.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Dana, do you want to put things in a box for us?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, let's just be practical for a second. So Greg said he's learned to be able to put that in a box; it doesn't bother him.  OK? For other people, it bothers them a lot, and it's all they think about.  And they think he's ruining their lives with his tone.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Unhealthy.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK. So there's -- So going forward, and now he's got to split Congress, so does the -- does his tone change in range? Does he figure out a way to, like, stake out a position that gets Nancy Pelosi to say, "OK, I'll meet you there"? I think it's going to be difficult to do. And as soon as they start picking at him for all the investigations, he's going to get his backup. But does he really want to get criminal justice reform done? I think he does. So there is a range, but the tone issue, that was part of what the midterm was about.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The question will be -- like a midterm is a referendum on the presidency, the president, but an election for a president is a choice between two people. So in 2016, that was your choice.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The two most unpopular candidates in the history of the country running against each other. He wins. Who do they put up in 2020 that could beat him? And I don't think it's just a matter of tone. It's going to be about policy, as well. So --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Absolutely.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- stay tuned.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Michael Moore.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: OK, Michael Moore. All right. Anger boiling over at the border as Tijuana residents clash with the caravan. How President Trump is responding. Up next.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Caravan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Throwback music. Tensions rising along the border with Mexico. Angry residents in Tijuana clashing with thousands of migrants from the Central American caravan, entering their city in the hopes of seeking asylum in the USA.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: We don't dislike a certain group of people, because they're from a country -- one country or another. We are here because our government has not taken control of these what we call invasions.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: (SPEAKING SPANISH)

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.sentences: What Donald Trump said is true. It's an invasion!

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The mayor there, quote, "warning" of a tsunami of nearly 3,000 people. It could last six months or more, they said. The Mexican government saying that the numbers could swell to as many as 10,000. Meanwhile, President Trump is demanding Democrats help secure the border. So Katie, I mean, the news as we are coming on air tonight was, oh, you know, those additional troops that were sent to the border? They're being pulled back.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Well, what was the mission? The mission was to help build fencing and barbed wire. And if you look at the photo the president sent out today, there's razor wire all over Tijuana's fence where these people are as a deterrent. So we'll see what they'll say about whether the mission was completed or not. But I find it interesting that a couple of weeks ago, everyone was wondering why President Trump was talking about the caravan. He's fearmongering, because it's so far away. Well, he was talking about it because now it's here. And we have a bottleneck now of thousands of people who are waiting around in Tijuana and stuck there as a result of not listening and going back to their home countries before getting there and claiming asylum. They're processing 100 people per day, and there's another caravan behind them of about 10,000 people that is going. And if you look at the screen to your left, this is a kind of violence that we've been hearing not from President Trump but from the Senate Judiciary Committee, reporters who been inside the caravan to see what's going on. And it's coming to a head now, and I'm just wondering if the people in Mexico are going to be accused of racism, like people in America, who warning about this type of humanitarian disaster that we've allowed to come into the country or beyond the border as a result of bad policies and laws that Congress refuses to change.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So Jesse, also we have judges, lawsuits being filed about the fact that the caravan, or immigrants seeking asylum, are being directed to ports like Tijuana, as opposed to being allowed to go to any spot which is what they lot now currently says in claim asylum.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I haven't heard that. I just can't believe how bigoted Mexico is. You know, Mexico should just be accepting these people. I mean, they are fleeing violence, Juan, and they're mostly women and children.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: In fact, the Mexicans --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: How dare these Mexicans treat these people so inhumanely?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Hey, wait a second, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They should be baking them goods and helping them on their travels.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Jesse, when the president was stirring this fear storm, you said, or maybe it was Greg, that that if the immigrant -- the migrants really were in danger, why don't they accept Mexico's deal? Which Mexico said, "You can stay here."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Did they? Is that what Mexico said?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And they said no. Because they want -- which was the dumbest thing and why it was driven by activists, is that they had -- they were offered a place to stay and they said, "No, we'll keep going. Thank you."

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They don't want to stay there.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Now you changed your mind. All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They want to keep going to America. I didn't change my message.  I know what your message was. Your message was the caravan was going to disappear.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: No, I didn't say that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Once the midterms happened --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I never said that.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: -- because you said this was a whole fantasy and Trump was stoking anger from his base to scare people up to voting.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's what he did.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And then all of a sudden, that after the midterms were over, we weren't going to hear about the caravan. Well, what -- you know what? The caravan is here, and the caravan is real. And the people in Mexico don't like it. You know what they said? They said, "I want a president who enforces immigration law, unlike our president, who's not doing it." They're very dissatisfied. And if you look at the local reporting, NBC did a very nice job. They said there are people scaring children at schools, doing things I'm not even going to repeat. They're begging, they're drinking, they're doing drugs. Five hundred of the members of the caravan in Tijuana right now are gang members, according to the reporter had on Dana's show, which I watch every single day, 2 p.m. Eastern. Don't miss "The Briefing."

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So Dana, the question now also before the courts is does violence, even domestic violence justify a claim of asylum?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, we've been talking about this for a little while. Because it will break your heart, right, but the government is not after you. I think it's one thing if you're fleeing violence. Is the government unwilling or unable to protect you? So if someone from a Syrian refugee might seem more -- you might feel more sympathetic towards that person then somebody who is fleeing a situation where they just want to have a better job and a chance at a better life. I feel like we should solve a lot of these problems at their sources.  There's also two big lawsuits that are happening regarding the asylum claims. I would just say this to Democrats. If the president is still willing to put that deal on the table, take him up on it. Because I don't think --

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: The one about the wall?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, it wasn't just the wall. It was DACA and you could fit -- you could figure out other conference of pieces of immigration. The business community wants more legal immigration. Take him up on it, because I don't think it will hurt your chances in 2020.  I think it would be a wash. So if they're thinking that, "Oh, we can't give him a win, because it will hurt us politically," I think they should sweep that aside. America needs to get this done.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: I think this also proves that countries have borders, whether you're Mexico or the United States. And Mexico is dealing with the problem of allowing these people to move up through, and now they have this very serious situation where thousands of people are camped out inside one of their cities. And the mayor and the people are saying, "Look, we just don't have the resources." It's the reality of the situation.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So I think it was driven to Tijuana. But Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: OK, here's -- there's an upside to this that we're missing, and that is that Mexico and America agree on something, and it's something that is actually universal. It is human nature to desire a process, an order and a border and, also you do feel a sense of line cutting. Especially with something that is politically manufactured, like this caravan, for lack of another phrase.  That's why they call it an invasion. Because there is really no other name for it. But the fact is itis human nature to be upset about this, and it's not racist. It's not racist.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Because these Mexicans are upset from Central Americans.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They're the same race.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It proves a very, very potent human point.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't think it was about race. I think it was about Trump trying to stir his base to get out and vote.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, you said it was about race for the whole midterm. Pull the tape.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You do that. Up next, get ready for a food fight. We're guessing the price of Thanksgiving staples in a new edition of "Supermarket Showdown."

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Is it New York prices?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Back by popular demand, a brand-new edition of "Supermarket Showdown." There it is. Best-dressed guy in the supermarket. Just in time for Thanksgiving, battling it out over our favorite Thanksgiving dinner items. Whoever guesses the closest without going over is the winner. And just a reminder: I won last time. And I don't know the answers ahead. First item is a frozen 15-pound turkey. We do not know if it's organic or not. It is just a frozen turkey. So everybody write their prices down.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Butterballs. Butterballs are nice.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Everybody up.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Fifty dollars?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I said 21.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, so the winner is -- The prices, ooh, $12.15.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wait, for that turkey?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: very good.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Does Juan win?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: No, it was whoever was under.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Yes, under.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wait a second. That's how much a turkey costs?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm getting ripped off, buying my turkey.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Greg pays $50 for a turkey.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wait a second, I was the closest, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Closest but over, Juan. Typical Democrat, doesn't want to follow the rules.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Oh, my God.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Recount.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Next up, 5 pounds of potatoes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Hold on. I have to erase my other one. Five pounds of potatoes.  Everybody write this down.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow, Katie, you really think?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: It's five pounds, times per pound.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.sentences: I say $4.

utterances.sentences: I said $8.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. What do we have? Five pounds of potatoes. The price is --

utterances.sentences: Where's Drew Carey?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wait, wait, wait.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Three-fifty, $3.50, $3.50!

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Dana won.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I was over by 50 cents.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That was close. Greg was in there. All right. Dana is now the leader. All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I drew Jesse, just if people want to know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Next one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Very expressive drawing. So we have 14-ounce Ocean Spray cranberry sauce. So, you know, cranberry sauce in a can. What do we say the price is there?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm going to do that. I did $0.89.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I am way over.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I did $2.85.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I did $3.99.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: What do you think it's going to be?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Cranberry sauce. Eighty-nine cents?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Are you going the lowest so you win, like "Price is Right"?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: One fifty-nine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan! Dana and Juan are tied for the lead at one apiece. Still everybody's open game. All right. Stovetop stuffing. All right. What do we think Stovetop stuffing is? Just a box. Stovetop stuffing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Small box.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right, everybody up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You can't win now, Dana.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What does everybody have? $2.89? Who wins?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Juan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh. Juan is going to win this thing, unless Dana scores the next one.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: The pumpkin pie came from New York.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The pumpkin pie is local. That means it's --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Four hundred dollars.

utterances.sentences: Supermarket or a bakery?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan, stop asking so many questions.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Supermarket.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Pumpkin pie, everybody. Manhattan pumpkin pie.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I haven't won a single thing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Eight twenty-five.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Thirteen fifty?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's Manhattan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, OK.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's true.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Ready? I'm in control here, Dana. Fourteen ninety-nine.  Watters puts one up there, but you know what? I didn't win. Juan won.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Good job, Juan.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Juan won. Williams, congratulations.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I think America won.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Does he get to take this home?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yes, I could bang my head with it. You know what's amazing about this?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What's that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I never go in a supermarket anymore.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: But you're really in touch with the American people.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Dumb luck, Williams. Dumb luck. All right. "One More Thing's" up next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: A man of the people, Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. It's time for --

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.sentences: Greg's Fox News

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Greg's Fox News." Well, I'd like to congratulate FOX News on moving to Russia. We have a FOX News in Russia now, check this out. This is at the -- I guess this is at a recent Moscow metro ride. A Russian woman with a pet fox nonchalantly perched on her shoulders raised a couple of eyebrows, but not many because it is Moscow. They usually have a lot of fur on. But it's not covering her body. I guess they have a lot of domesticated red foxes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Not the Redd Foxx I remember. He wasn't domesticated. He had a lot of blue humor. Let me tell you, Dana. You're next.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Well, I have a much cuter animal to show you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Please.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I believe in giving the people what they want on this show. And I haven't shown --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: When are you going to start.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- people Jasper for a long time. Jasper and I got -- we were separated for a week last week. We reunited. And here we are reunited.  We can go through these a little faster. He slept for two hours in all these different positions holding onto me.  We just had the best time. We went shopping and we got some Christmas gifts. He ate some yogurt out of a tub, and he fished in the lake.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: And that's all. That's Jasper for you.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Any more? Any more pictures? Please, let's go through it again.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, fine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Juan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We were separated for a week.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: Very cute.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So over the weekend I did a book signing at the Howard University bookstore Barnes & Noble, HUB. I was interviewed by Chris Steele. And that was a treat for me, because even though he's now a State Department diplomat 20 years ago he was a researcher for my Thurgood Marshall biography. Here I am signing a huge poster advertising the event, over posters of other authors, James Baldwin, Maya Angelou. And here I am at a table where they surprised me with a display of my other books. So thank you so much to the folks at Howard. And if you're looking for a conversation starter this Christmas, like me and Jesse would talk about it for years, be sure to pick up a copy of the book.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And I just want to congratulate Juan. Two men have won the supermarket showcase showdown on the show. So you know what?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Me and you.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: We're dispelling a lot of myths here, Williams.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: There you go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Do you know what I mean? Maybe the ladies will win one, one of these days.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Whoa.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. Not a challenge. It's a fact. All right. So do you remember how we were talking about swiping your credit card when you're alone to kind of, like, put a fingerprint down to make sure you don't get busted and set up. Well, this happened to a guy.  He was facing 99 years in prison for slicing his girlfriend up with a box cutter. Turns out he took a selfie with his mom. Ended up getting him off. Time stamped on the iPhone ended up saving his you know what.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So take a lot of selfies.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I took another. There I am on my selfie. So no, I did not commit a crime while I was taking the selfie.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: No, that selfie is a crime. Katie.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.sentences: That was good. OK. Wreaths Across America. It's Thanksgiving week. However, we are all grateful for our fallen veterans. Wreaths Across America needs volunteers for 1,400 locations across the country to put wreaths on the graves of veterans. So you can sign up to donate or to volunteer at Wreaths Across America. And another thing, real quickly, my parents are in the middle of Arizona, elk -- scouting for elk. My dad has a hunt soon. And they are holding up "The Five." And they're saying, everybody here, happy Thanksgiving.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: They have such a fetish for guns.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Never miss an episode of "The Five." "Special Report" is up next. Bret Baier.
